parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.68

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of all simple objects that belong to the listed class names. If the array of types is empty [], all simple objects are returned including those without class name.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>
*There is no inheritance in simple objects, so only exact class match is allowed.
* ''className'' is not case sensitive.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[allSimpleObjects]] classes

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> classes: [[Array]] of [[String]]s - classnames array. Use <tt>[]</tt> to return all simple objects

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - array of [[createSimpleObject|simple objects]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[allSimpleObjects]] ["Box_NATO_Equip_F", "Land_CampingChair_V2_F"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_allSimpleObjects = [[allSimpleObjects]] [];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[createSimpleObject]], [[isSimpleObject]], [[nearestObjects]], [[nearObjectsReady]], [[nearObjects]], [[nearestObject]], [[createVehicle]]
</value></part></template>
